name: vscode-healthier
description: An opinionated code style agnostic linter â€“ a friendly companion to Prettier.

healthier.enable.description: Controls whether JavaScript Healthier Style is enabled for JavaScript files or not.

healthier.enableGlobally.description: Controls whether JavaScript Healthier Style is enabled globally for JavaScript files or not.

healthier.nodePath.description: A path added to NODE_PATH when resolving the healthier module.

healthier.options.description: The healthier options object to provide args normally passed to JavaScript Healthier Style when executed from a command line.

healthier.engine.description: Controls whether VSCode should use an alternate Healthier engine, like ts-healthier.

healthier.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the JavaScript Healthier Style linter service.

healthier.run.description: Run the linter on save (onSave) or on type (onType)

healthier.autoFixOnSave.description: Turns auto fix on save on or off.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path start with this directory.

changeProcessCWD.description: Whether the process's cwd should be changed as well.

language.description: The language id to be validated by JavaScript Healthier Style

autoFix.description: Whether auto fixes are provided for the language

healthier.validate.description: An array of language ids which should be validated by JavaScript Healthier Style

healthier.usePackageJson.description: Activate JavaScript Healthier Style based on project's package.json settings, use globally installed healthier module if set to "false"

healthier.treatErrorsAsWarnings.description: Any linting error reported by Healthier will instead be displayed as a warning within VS Code.

commands.title: Enable JavaScript Healthier Style for this Workspace
Disable JavaScript Healthier Style for this Workspace

scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..
scripts.lint: cd client && npm run lint && cd ../server && npm run lint && cd ..
scripts.format: cd client && npm run format && cd ../server && npm run format && cd ..
